block.p: Melissa Caroline Meyers and Wilbur Frank Foster Jr., lawyers in New York, were married yesterday in Hilton Head, S.C. Dr. Lewis W. Johnson, the brother-in-law of the bride and a notary public, officiated at the Crown Plaza Hotel.
Ms. Meyers is a partner in Garson, Gerspach, DeCorato & Cohen, and Mr. Foster is a partner in Milbank, Tweed, Hadley & McCloy, both New York law firms.

Melissa Caroline Meyers and Wilbur Frank Foster Jr., lawyers in New York, were married yesterday in Hilton Head, S.C. Dr. Lewis W. Johnson, the brother-in-law of the bride and a notary public, officiated at the Crown Plaza Hotel.
Ms. Meyers is a partner in Garson, Gerspach, DeCorato & Cohen, and Mr. Foster is a partner in Milbank, Tweed, Hadley & McCloy, both New York law firms.

The bride, 46, graduated from the University of Rochester, and received a master's degree in nursing from New York University and a law degree from Yeshiva University. She is a daughter of the late Phyllis S. and Edwin C. Meyers. The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.

The bridegroom, 44, was until 1986 a captain in the Judge Advocate General's Corps of the United States Army. He graduated magna cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania, where he received bachelor's degrees in political science and in economics. He received his law degree cum laude from N.Y.U. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Foster of Mount Ephraim, N.J.
